alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 2:08PM MDT until June 17 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Elbert County in east central Colorado... * Until 500 PM MDT. * At 208 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Elbert County This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Sandy Creek, Reed Springs Creek, East Bijou Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
